metadata.title: CVE-2017-10268 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server: Replication). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.57 andearlier, 5.6.37 and earlier and 5.7.19 and earlier. Difficult to exploitvulnerability allows high privileged attacker with logon to theinfrastructure where MySQL Server executes to compromise MySQL Server.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized accessto critical data or complete access to all MySQL Server accessible data.CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.1 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10268` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libmariadbd18 - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-client - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-client-10.0 - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-client-core-10.0 - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-common - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-plugin-tokudb - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-server - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-server-10.0 - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-server-core-10.0 - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-test - 10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
mariadb-10.0 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.0.36-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
